case_title: RAMLAL ONKARMAL vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX, ASSAM

commissioner_action.reason: Loss of Rs. 32,759 from Durgapur Tea Estate should not have been set off under section 24(1) proviso

legal_issue: Whether the Commissioner's order under section 33-B is valid?

section_33_B.introduced_by: Income-tax and Business Profits Tax Amendment Act, 1948
conditions: Order by Income-tax Officer is erroneous and prejudicial to revenue
No revision of re-assessment under section 34
Revision within two years of the order

powers_of_appellate_assistant_commission: Confirm, reduce, enhance, or annul assessment
Income-tax Officer has right to be heard

key_points: Section 33-B powers are not restricted by pending appeals unless explicitly stated.
Contrast between sections 33-A and 33-B highlights broader powers under section 33-B.
Supreme Court precedent supports the Commissioner's authority under section 33-B even during pending appeals.

precedents_considered.case_name: Commissioner of Income-tax v. Amritlal Bhogilal & Co.
precedents_considered.decision: Commissioner cannot revise during pending appeal

precedents_considered.case_name: Smt. Durgabati and Smt. Narmadabala Gupta v. Commissioner of Income-tax

final_decision.reasoning: Section 33-B explicitly allows revision by Commissioner without restrictions related to pending appeals.
